inclusion.criterion: Be informed of the nature of the study and have provided written informed consent
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not explicitly mention this, but it is a standard requirement for clinical trials.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient is 45 years old, which meets the criterion.

inclusion.criterion: ECOG performance of 0, 1, or 2, or KPS ≥ 60
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention ECOG or KPS scores.

inclusion.criterion: Pathological verification of a WHO grade 4 astrocytoma (glioblastoma or gliosarcoma)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma, which is a type of WHO grade 3 tumor.

inclusion.criterion: Documented recurrent glioblastoma, gliosarcoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, anaplastic oligodendroglioma, anaplastic oligoastrocytoma, or anaplastic ependymoma after at least one failed treatment of chemotherapy and radiation
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma that is unresectable and has received radiation therapy.

inclusion.criterion: Expected survival of at least 3 months
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention expected survival time.

inclusion.criterion: At least 2-weeks from cytoreductive surgery, if performed, 4-weeks from bevacizumab or other chemotherapy (6-weeks if prior chemotherapy was nitrosourea) and 12-weeks from completion of radiotherapy
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent surgeries, chemotherapy, or radiation therapy.

inclusion.criterion: Ability to undergo MRI scanning without and with imaging dye on a periodic basis as defined in the protocol
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has undergone MRI scans in the past, which suggests they can tolerate them.

inclusion.criterion: Preserved major organ functions, i.e: Blood leukocyte count ≥ 3.0 x 10^9/L Blood absolute neutrophil count ≥ 1.5 x 10^9/L Blood platelet count ≥ 100 x 10^9/L Blood hemoglobin ≥ 100 g/L (transfusions are allowed) Plasma total bilirubin level ≤ 1.5 times the upper institutional limit (ULN) of the ‖normal‖ range Plasma AST (aspartate aminotransferase) or ALT ≤ 2.5 times upper institutional limit (ULN) of the ‖normal‖ range Plasma creatinine ≤ 1.5 times upper institutional limit (ULN) of the ‖normal‖ range
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent blood work or organ function tests.

inclusion.criterion: 12-lead ECG with normal tracings; or changes that are not clinically significant and do not require medical intervention, and QTc < 500 ms
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent ECG results.

inclusion.criterion: At least seven (7) days off of medications which inhibit or induce CYP2C9 or CYP3A4 before first study treatment day
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention current medication regimen.

exclusion.criterion: Any other major recent or ongoing disease that, according to the Investigator, poses an unacceptable risk to the patient
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text mentions a history of severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention, but it is unclear if this is current.

exclusion.criterion: Grade 3 or higher constipation within the past 28 days or grade 2 constipation within the past 14 days before randomization
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent bowel movements or constipation issues.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text mentions hypertension and chronic pain, but it is unclear if these are well-controlled.

exclusion.criterion: Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C, or HIV infection requiring anti-retroviral therapy
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent liver function tests or HIV status.

exclusion.criterion: Active malignancy other than basal cell skin cancer
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma, but it is unclear if this is active.

exclusion.criterion: Other active malignancy during the previous 3 years
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent cancer diagnoses or treatments.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention recent surgeries.

exclusion.criterion: Prior stereotactic or gamma knife radiosurgery or proton radiation, unless unequivocal progression by functional neuro-imaging (PET, dynamic MRI, MRS, SPECT) or by re-operation with documented histologic confirmation of recurrence
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text mentions radiation therapy in the past, but it is unclear if this was recent.

exclusion.criterion: Prior anti-tumor therapy, as follows: at least 12-weeks from radiation therapy; at least 4-weeks from prior treatment with temozolomide or bevacizumab, 6-weeks from BCNU or CCNU
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text mentions recent chemotherapy and radiation therapy.

notes: Key unknowns include expected survival time, recent blood work and organ function tests, current medication regimen, and recent ECG results. Additionally, it is unclear if the patient's anaplastic astrocytoma is active or recurrent.
